intro: Sisymbrium polyphyllum, commonly known as the many-leafed mustard, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like cabbage and mustard. The plant is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves and clusters of small, yellow flowers. It produces cylindrical seed pods that contain numerous tiny, black seeds. Sisymbrium polyphyllum is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats, including roadsides and meadows.
